content.html:
A block all/never suggest any of these again option would come in handy on a screen like this.

(I have nothing against toyartistry!)

Published Tuesday, Nov 22 at 06:22
content.value:
A screenshot of Tumblr's "Let's follow some tags" screen that suggests tags to follow. Listed are things like twitter drama, twitter refugees, twitpocalypse, rip twitter, elon musk twitter. 



A block all/never suggest any of these again option would come in handy on a screen like this.



(I have nothing against toyartistry!)

content.html:
‚Ä∫ git cd ..
WARNING: You called a Git command named 'cd', which does not exist.
Continuing in 0.1 seconds, assuming that you meant 'co'.

Oops. I‚Äôm so happy I only had a one word change waiting to be staged. I think this is the first time a git autocorrect has not gone in my favor.

content.html:
I haven‚Äôt deleted my Twitter account because twitter.com/jeremyfelt has been mine for over 15 years and I‚Äôm not comfortable with a bot or handle doppelg√§nger snatching it up in 30 days.

I have made my account private and I‚Äôm only visiting daily to see if anyone else has joined a Mastodon instance.

Strangely, I‚Äôve also requested credentials for a new Twitter dev account. üôÉ

I‚Äôll use that to programmatically delete all of my tweets except for the one I have pinned and my last. üé®

content.html:

Newsletters with feeds are now in my feed reader, I‚Äôll probably forget about the others soon enough. üôÇ
